pull.title: net: Disconnect message follow-ups to #28521
pull.body:
- Add missing calls to `DisconnectMsg()` - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#discussion_r1890824361
- Specify context when stopping nodes - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#discussion_r1890780754
- Bring back log message when resetting socket in case new entrypoints are added - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#discussion_r1890795074
- Use `DisconnectMsg()` in `CConnman` as well - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28521#discussion_r1791797716

net_processing: Add missing use of DisconnectMsg

Makes it easier to grep logs for "disconnecting" when investigating disconnections.

net: Switch to DisconnectMsg in CConnman

events.message: net: Switch to DisconnectMsg in CConnman

events.body:
> I think there's still one log to update to use DisconnectMsg in net.cpp :

Thanks! Clear enough case to warrant a new push together with the [remaining nit](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31633#discussion_r1910230992).

After the latest push, there still remain 4 cases, but they are a bit harder to re-word, and at least contain "disconnecting":
```
₿ git grep -n "\bLog.*disconnecting"
src/net_processing.cpp:3446:            LogPrintf("connected to self at %s, disconnecting\n", pfrom.addr.ToStringAddrPort());
src/net_processing.cpp:4913:        LogDebug(BCLog::NET, "Warning: disconnecting but not discouraging %s peer %d!\n",
src/net_processing.cpp:5103:                LogDebug(BCLog::NET, "disconnecting extra block-relay-only peer=%d (last block received at time %d)\n",
src/net_processing.cpp:5154:                    LogDebug(BCLog::NET, "disconnecting extra outbound peer=%d (last block announcement received at time %d)\n", pnode->GetId(), oldest_block_announcement);
```
Also attempted to double-check using `git grep -n -A1 -B1 -E "(fDisconnect.*=[^=]*|CloseSocketDisconnect)"`, didn't spot any further cases.

re-utACK 551a09486c495e1a3cfc296eafdf95e914856bff

Adds the case @danielabrozzoni found and replaces 3 `;` with `,`

Tested and Review ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/551a09486c495e1a3cfc296eafdf95e914856bff

More `disconnectmsg` reuse, provides context in the node shutdown disconnect case, and makes disconnect logging more granular.

<details><summary>Node shutdown</summary>

```console
$ bitcoin-cli stop
$ tail -n 60 debug.log | grep "\[net\]"
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Stopping node, disconnecting peer=1
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=1
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=1
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Stopping node, disconnecting peer=2
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=2
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=2
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Stopping node, disconnecting peer=3
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=3
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=3
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Stopping node, disconnecting peer=4
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=4
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=4
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Stopping node, disconnecting peer=5
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=5
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=5
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Stopping node, disconnecting peer=6
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=6
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=6
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Stopping node, disconnecting peer=12
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=12
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=12
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Stopping node, disconnecting peer=13
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=13
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=13
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Stopping node, disconnecting peer=15
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=15
2025-01-27T17:37:29Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=15
```

</details>

<details><summary>setnetworkactive false</summary>

```console
$ bitcoin-cli setnetworkactive=false
$ tail -n 60 debug.log | grep "\[net\]"
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=0
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=1
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=2
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=3
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=4
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=5
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=0
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=1
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=2
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=3
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=4
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=5
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=0
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=1
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=2
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=3
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=4
2025-01-27T17:33:40Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=5
```

</details>

comments.body: I found the `%d%s` format weird at first, but I see it is an existing format, e.g. https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/net.cpp#L705
super-nit: above we're using a simple `,` before the `DisconnectMsg`, not a `;`.
nit: many other similar logs here were capitalized
unrelated: do we really need this level of detail for a timeout (i.e. ms precision expressed in seconds)?
This does make the debug level even noisier. But since it doesn't have the word "disconnect" it's probably fine.
What do you think about downgrading it to `LogTrace`?
Agree, will change if I re-touch.

ping on my main system seems to care about ms+3 decimals (I'm guessing that's milliseconds+3 decimals => microseconds):
```
₿ ping 192.168.1.133
PING 192.168.1.133 (192.168.1.133): 56 data bytes
64 bytes from 192.168.1.133: icmp_seq=0 ttl=214 time=0.765 ms
```
I feel a slight itch here as well, but will probably leave casing as-is as in keeping with the original pull request.
That seems better, if you need to retouch.

I'm OK with having each phase of node disconnect logged like this since I could imagine there are edge cases where it might be important to know whether or not the peer's socket has been reset or if we've just made the decision to disconnect the peer, in playing with it a few times it looks like this log has already revealed some interesting behavior where we're retrying with v1 transport when maybe we shouldn't be:

```console
$ bitcoin-cli setnetworkactive=false
$ tail -n 60 debug.log | grep "\[net\]"
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=1
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=4
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=7
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=11
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Network not active, disconnecting peer=12
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=1
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=4
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=7
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=11
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] retrying with v1 transport protocol for peer=12 # <-----
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Resetting socket for peer=12
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=1
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=4
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=7
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=11
2025-01-27T17:20:38Z [net] Cleared nodestate for peer=12
```

Hm.. seems like maybe we should be checking `fNetworkActive` in another place - in the same condition as `ShouldReconnectV1()`?

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/551a09486c495e1a3cfc296eafdf95e914856bff/src/net.cpp#L1890-L1912
(The buggy reconnection attempts are handled in new PR #32073).
